original: mi 'dod na yang dbang med 'dir ni 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'dod na yang dbang med 'dir ni 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: and even without desiring it, one helplessly obtains it.

original: gang zhig ba glang rta bong rnga mo'i skye gnas 'gro //
analyzed: gang zhig ba glang rta bong rnga mo'i skye gnas 'gro //
translated: One who goes to the wombs of cows, horses, donkeys, and camels,

original: mnga' bdag nyid du gyur na de ni bsnyen min zhing //
analyzed: mnga' bdag nyid du gyur na de ni bsnyen min zhing //
translated: is not to be served even if he becomes a lord.

original: de ru 'gro ba'i sdig pa'i las ni byed pa dang / sdug bsngal mi 'dod su yis sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ru 'gro ba'i sdig pa'i las ni byed pa dang / sdug bsngal mi 'dod su yis sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur //
translated: Who would commit sinful actions that lead there, and create suffering, not desiring suffering?

original: gal te 'jig rten dag na skyes bu byed par gyur //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten dag na skyes bu byed par gyur //
translated: If the person were the agent in the world,

original: sdug bsngal byed pa ma yin bde ba kho na byed //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byed pa ma yin bde ba kho na byed //
translated: It does not cause suffering, but only happiness.

original: 'dod pa byed par 'dod kyang mi 'dod byed pa ste //
analyzed: 'dod pa byed par 'dod kyang mi 'dod byed pa ste //
translated: Even if you want to do what you want, you do what you don’t want.

original: dbang phyug chen por 'gyur na mi 'dod su yis spyod //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen por 'gyur na mi 'dod su yis spyod //
translated: If you become Maheśvara, who enjoys what is not wanted?

original: gang tshe mi ni chos min pa la rnam 'jigs shing //
analyzed: gang tshe mi ni chos min pa la rnam 'jigs shing //
translated: When a person is afraid of non-Dharma,

original: 'bad pas chos ni rab tu son par byed pa nyid //
analyzed: 'bad pas chos ni rab tu son par byed pa nyid //
translated: and strives to attain Dharma,

original: sna tshogs nyon mongs rnams kyis dbang med 'phrog ba ste //
analyzed: sna tshogs nyon mongs rnams kyis dbang med 'phrog ba ste //
translated: he is carried away by the various afflictions,

original: de phyir 'di na mi ni pha rol rgyud du gyur //
analyzed: de phyir 'di na mi ni pha rol rgyud du gyur //
translated: and thus becomes subject to another in this world.

original: grang dang dro dang char dang thog dang glog sogs kyi //
analyzed: grang dang dro dang char dang thog dang glog sogs kyi //
translated: The activities of cold, heat, rain, hail, lightning, and so on

original: bya ba rnams ni mi la bzlog nas mthong ba ste //
analyzed: bya ba rnams ni mi la bzlog nas mthong ba ste //
translated: are seen to be directed towards humans.

original: gang phyir rang dbang ma yin mi ni gzhan ldan te //
analyzed: gang phyir rang dbang ma yin mi ni gzhan ldan te //
translated: Because humans are not independent, but dependent on others,

original: de phyir bya ba rnams su skyes bu dbang phyug min //🔽gang tshe sa bon las dang sa chu'i rten las ni //
analyzed: de phyir bya ba rnams su skyes bu dbang phyug min // gang tshe sa bon las dang sa chu'i rten las ni //
translated: therefore the person is not the lord of activities.🔽When from the seed, through the support of earth and water,

original: dus sbyor rab tu 'jug la lo thog phun tshogs shing //
analyzed: dus sbyor rab tu 'jug la lo thog phun tshogs shing //
translated: the conjunctions operate, and the harvest is abundant,

original: mar me dag las rab gsal shing las me yin te //🔽rgyu med las yin zhes pa rgyu med ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me dag las rab gsal shing las me yin te // rgyu med las yin zhes pa rgyu med ma yin no //
translated: The light of the lamp is from the wick and oil,🔽not from the flame, nor from the dish, nor from the stick, nor from space, nor from the hand, nor from the effort of the maker, nor from the thread, nor from the oil-pot, nor from the wick-box, nor from the action of the person, nor from the cause of all these things, nor from the cause of all these things together.

original: rgyu med pa las gal te 'gro ba'i rab 'jug na //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las gal te 'gro ba'i rab 'jug na //
translated: If the world were to arise without a cause,

original: mi yi byed pa yis ni med par 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: mi yi byed pa yis ni med par 'gyur pa ste //
translated: then it would not be possible for it to arise through human effort.

original: thams cad kyis ni thams cad nges par 'thob byed cing //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni thams cad nges par 'thob byed cing //
translated: And all would certainly obtain everything,

original: rtag na 'di ni thams cad du ni song bar grub //
analyzed: rtag na 'di ni thams cad du ni song bar grub //
translated: and it would be established that this [world] is always present everywhere.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal gal te rgyu med las yin na //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal gal te rgyu med las yin na //
translated: If pleasure and pain were to arise without a cause,

original: gang char kun gyi bde dang sdug bsngal skal min zhing //
analyzed: gang char kun gyi bde dang sdug bsngal skal min zhing //
translated: then pleasure and pain would not be the lot of all,

original: rgyu med las kyang bde dang sdug bsngal rtogs min te //
analyzed: rgyu med las kyang bde dang sdug bsngal rtogs min te //
translated: and pleasure and pain would not be understood without a cause.

original: de phyir rgyu med las shes 'di ni rgyu ma yin //🔽de skad ces pa la sogs mi mnyan rgyu rnams des //
analyzed: de phyir rgyu med las shes 'di ni rgyu ma yin // de skad ces pa la sogs mi mnyan rgyu rnams des //
translated: Therefore, this knowledge of arising without a cause is not a cause.

original: 'jig rten rab tu 'jug la rgyu rnams shes ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten rab tu 'jug la rgyu rnams shes ma yin //
translated: Because of such statements, the causes of the engagement of the world are not known.

original: rgyu med par ni 'jig rten mthong ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni 'jig rten mthong ba ma yin zhing //
translated: The world is not seen to arise without a cause,

original: nyes pa 'di rnams rgyu med las ni yang dag rtogs //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di rnams rgyu med las ni yang dag rtogs //
translated: and these faults are properly understood to arise without a cause.

original: brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba'i 'byung bo rnams su yang //
analyzed: brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba'i 'byung bo rnams su yang //
translated: The elements, whether stable or moving,

original: @67b de dang de la brten nas de dang de 'byung ste //
analyzed: @67b de dang de la brten nas de dang de 'byung ste //
translated: arise from this and that in dependence on this and that.

original: 'jig rten dag na rgyu med ci yang yod min zhing //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na rgyu med ci yang yod min zhing //
translated: There is nothing in the world that exists without a cause,

original: kun gyi rgyu ni 'jig rten pa yis shes ma yin //
analyzed: kun gyi rgyu ni 'jig rten pa yis shes ma yin //
translated: and the cause of everything is not known by the worldly.

original: de nas sbyin pa bzang por byin pa'i bzang byin des //
analyzed: de nas sbyin pa bzang por byin pa'i bzang byin des //
translated: Then, that good giver, having given good gifts,

original: rgya che'i chos kyis dam pa'i chos ni rnam shes nas //
analyzed: rgya che'i chos kyis dam pa'i chos ni rnam shes nas //
translated: having understood the Dharma of the Great Vehicle through the excellent Dharma,

original: g-yo ba med pa'i blo gros des par rab dang bas //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i blo gros des par rab dang bas //
translated: with a mind of unwavering intelligence, pure and clear,

original: drang srong chen po la ni tshig 'di gsal ba'o //🔽mnyan yong rta ljang rta rid kyis bsnyen grong khyer ni //
analyzed: drang srong chen po la ni tshig 'di gsal ba'o // mnyan yong rta ljang rta rid kyis bsnyen grong khyer ni //
translated: clearly spoke these words to the Great Sage:🔽The city of my abode, renowned for its merit,

original: bdag gi gnas kyi sa ni bsod nams grags pa can //
analyzed: bdag gi gnas kyi sa ni bsod nams grags pa can //
translated: is approached by green horses and emaciated horses.

original: der ni bdag gis khyed kyi gnas ni byed 'dod de //
analyzed: der ni bdag gis khyed kyi gnas ni byed 'dod de //
translated: There, I wish to make your abode,

original: sdig med gnas mchog dam pa de ni bsnyen par mdzod //
analyzed: sdig med gnas mchog dam pa de ni bsnyen par mdzod //
translated: please approach that excellent and supreme abode without sin.

original: gang lta na yang thub pa khyed kyi gnas su snyoms pa ni //
analyzed: gang lta na yang thub pa khyed kyi gnas su snyoms pa ni //
translated: Even if it is not equal to your abode, O Sage,

original: gzhal yas khang gi logs sam rnam dben nags su ste //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi logs sam rnam dben nags su ste //
translated: In the palace or in a secluded forest,

original: bdag la rjes su brtse phyir gnas kyi ched du ni //
analyzed: bdag la rjes su brtse phyir gnas kyi ched du ni //
translated: For the sake of abiding, out of love for me,

original: dgra bcom rab tu gzhes par mdzad par 'os pa lags //
analyzed: dgra bcom rab tu gzhes par mdzad par 'os pa lags //
translated: It is fitting that the Arhats should remain.

original: de nas gtong bar lhag par mos pa 'di yis ni //🔽rnam par grol ba'i sems ni rnam par mkhyen nas ni //
analyzed: de nas gtong bar lhag par mos pa 'di yis ni // rnam par grol ba'i sems ni rnam par mkhyen nas ni //
translated: Then, with this surpassing devotion to giving,🔽Having known the liberated mind,

original: chags pa med pa'i blo mnga' blo gros mkhyen pa yis //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i blo mnga' blo gros mkhyen pa yis //
translated: With a mind of unobstructed understanding,

original: mchog tu zhi bas blo gros yang dag bka' stsal to //🔽sems dpa' brtan kye gang zhig rdzas glog g-yo rnams su //
analyzed: mchog tu zhi bas blo gros yang dag bka' stsal to // sems dpa' brtan kye gang zhig rdzas glog g-yo rnams su //
translated: He spoke these words of supreme peace:

original: khyod kyi sems dpa' gtong la lhag par mos pa ste //
analyzed: khyod kyi sems dpa' gtong la lhag par mos pa ste //
translated: “O steadfast one, your mind is devoted to giving away🔽Even the things that flicker like lightning.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni spyin la dga' zhing chos la dgyes //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni spyin la dga' zhing chos la dgyes //
translated: You delight in giving by nature and in the Dharma.

original: de nyid mthong ba khyed la de ni ngo mtshar min //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba khyed la de ni ngo mtshar min //
translated: For you, who see reality, this is no wonder.

original: gang zhig khyim ni tshig las phyi rol 'thon byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig khyim ni tshig las phyi rol 'thon byed pa //
translated: One who leaves home when it is burning

original: de yi don de 'tshig par byed pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de yi don de 'tshig par byed pa ma yin te //
translated: Does not do so for the sake of that which is burning.

original: de bzhin dus kyi me yis 'gro ba tshig pa na //
analyzed: de bzhin dus kyi me yis 'gro ba tshig pa na //
translated: In the same way, when the fire of time burns the world,

original: gang gis gang zhig sbyin pa de yis de nyer 'thob //
analyzed: gang gis gang zhig sbyin pa de yis de nyer 'thob //
translated: Whatever is given by whomever is obtained by him.

original: de phyir rnam spangs sems dpa' rnams kyis sbyin par dang // yul rnams yang dag longs spyod par ni shes pa nyid //
analyzed: de phyir rnam spangs sems dpa' rnams kyis sbyin par dang // yul rnams yang dag longs spyod par ni shes pa nyid //
translated: Therefore, the wise should give, and the wise should enjoy objects.

original: bkren pa 'jig rten dag na zad pa'i skyon mthong bas //
analyzed: bkren pa 'jig rten dag na zad pa'i skyon mthong bas //
translated: The miserly are seen to have the fault of wasting in the world.

original: nye bar longs spyod ma yin 'jigs las sbyin ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod ma yin 'jigs las sbyin ma yin //
translated: They do not enjoy, they do not give out of fear,🔽They give at the wrong time, they give with contempt, they give with a purpose,

original: dus su smod la don ni rnam par gtong ba dang // dpal dang nga rgyal las ni de bzhin g-yul 'gyed par //
analyzed: dus su smod la don ni rnam par gtong ba dang // dpal dang nga rgyal las ni de bzhin g-yul 'gyed par //
translated: They give with pride, they give in battle,

original: sems dpa' lhag pa nyid kyis shes te gzhan gyis min //
analyzed: sems dpa' lhag pa nyid kyis shes te gzhan gyis min //
translated: The wise know this, not others.

original: sems dpa' yis ni sbyin pa nyid dang g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: sems dpa' yis ni sbyin pa nyid dang g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: The hero gives, the hero fights.

original: spyin byed dga' pa nyid du 'gro la 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: spyin byed dga' pa nyid du 'gro la 'gro ba ste //
translated: The giver goes to heaven,

original: snyan pa dang ni dam par grags pa rab tu 'thob //
analyzed: snyan pa dang ni dam par grags pa rab tu 'thob //
translated: He obtains fame and high status.

original: sbyin pa po yod gang zhes dam pa rnams sbyin nas //
analyzed: sbyin pa po yod gang zhes dam pa rnams sbyin nas //
translated: The good give, saying, “Where is the giver?”

original: yang @68a * //
analyzed: yang @68a * //
translated: Again,

original: dag bkur ba dang ni mngon du 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: dag bkur ba dang ni mngon du 'gro bar byed //
translated: They are respected and become objects of veneration.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten dag na blo gtad nyid 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten dag na blo gtad nyid 'gyur zhing //
translated: They become objects of trust in the world,

original: mi bzad pa rnams las kyang nyes pa 'thob ma yin //
analyzed: mi bzad pa rnams las kyang nyes pa 'thob ma yin //
translated: and are not harmed by terrible things.

original: bsod nams rnams ni bdag gis byas zhes tshim pa ste //
analyzed: bsod nams rnams ni bdag gis byas zhes tshim pa ste //
translated: They are satisfied with the thought, “I have done good deeds.”

original: 'chi ba'i dus su skrag par mngon par 'gro ma yin /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su skrag par mngon par 'gro ma yin /
translated: They do not go to a fearful place at the time of death.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dir ni me tog tsam zhig ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dir ni me tog tsam zhig ste //
translated: The fruit of generosity is like a flower here,

original: sbyin pa po yi 'bras bu gzhan nyid rab tu 'thob //🔽'khor ba'i 'khor lo la ni 'khor ba'i skye bo yi //
analyzed: sbyin pa po yi 'bras bu gzhan nyid rab tu 'thob // 'khor ba'i 'khor lo la ni 'khor ba'i skye bo yi //
translated: but the fruit of the giver is obtained elsewhere.

original: gtong ba dang mnyam gnyen ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtong ba dang mnyam gnyen ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no friend equal to generosity🔽for beings who are wandering in the cycle of existence.

original: mi yi 'jig rten na dang lhan skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: mi yi 'jig rten na dang lhan skyes pa rnams //
translated: The innate ones in the human world

original: gtong ba las dang mnyam pa rnams las lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gtong ba las dang mnyam pa rnams las lhag par 'gyur //
translated: are superior to those who are equal in generosity.

original: rta dang glang po'i skye gnas su yang gnas pa rnams //
analyzed: rta dang glang po'i skye gnas su yang gnas pa rnams //
translated: Even those who are born as horses and elephants

original: 'bras bu de ni gtso bo thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni gtso bo thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: attain that principal fruit.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod rnams kyis yongs su 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod rnams kyis yongs su 'dzin pa ste //
translated: By generosity, one is held dear by those who are poor.

original: tshul khrims kyis bsrungs mtho ris su ni 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽ye shes sngon du 'gro ba can gyi zhi ba yis kyang ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis bsrungs mtho ris su ni 'gro bar 'gyur // ye shes sngon du 'gro ba can gyi zhi ba yis kyang ni //
translated: By morality, one is reborn in a good destiny.🔽By wisdom, one is reborn in the heavens.

original: rten dang bral ba gang na grangs su 'gro ba 'gro ma yin //
analyzed: rten dang bral ba gang na grangs su 'gro ba 'gro ma yin //
translated: By peace, which is preceded by wisdom, one goes to the place free from support, where one does not go by means of going.

original: 'chi med bdud rtsi de yis 'thob pa'i ched du yang //
analyzed: 'chi med bdud rtsi de yis 'thob pa'i ched du yang //
translated: For the sake of attaining that immortal nectar,

original: sngom par gyur pa rab tu sbyin pa yin pa nyid //
analyzed: sngom par gyur pa rab tu sbyin pa yin pa nyid //
translated: one is bound to give.

original: sbyin pa dran nas rab tu dga' bar gyur pa ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa dran nas rab tu dga' bar gyur pa ste //
translated: By remembering generosity, one is delighted.

original: yid ni rab tu dga' las nges par ting 'dzin yin //
analyzed: yid ni rab tu dga' las nges par ting 'dzin yin //
translated: From the delight of mind, there is concentration.

original: mnyam par gzhag na yang dag mtho ba 'di ru ni //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag na yang dag mtho ba 'di ru ni //
translated: When concentrated, one sees the perfect truth.

original: skye dang 'god pa shes par rim gyis 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skye dang 'god pa shes par rim gyis 'gyur ba ste //
translated: From that, one gradually comes to know birth and cessation.

original: gzhan la sbyin pa sbyin pa'i sbyin pa po yis ni //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin pa sbyin pa'i sbyin pa po yis ni //
translated: The giver who gives to others

original: snying la gnas pa'i nyon mongs rnams ni bsrabs par 'gyur //
analyzed: snying la gnas pa'i nyon mongs rnams ni bsrabs par 'gyur //
translated: diminishes the afflictions that dwell in the heart.

original: gang zhig sbyin pa byin byed de yi don rnams su //
analyzed: gang zhig sbyin pa byin byed de yi don rnams su //
translated: The one who gives generosity

original: chags par grags pa de ni dang por chod pa nyid ;
analyzed: chags par grags pa de ni dang por chod pa nyid ;
translated: That which is known as attachment is first of all a bond.

original: / gang la rab tu byams pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa ste //
analyzed: / gang la rab tu byams pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa ste //
translated: But when one gives with a mind of love for someone,

original: de phyir zhes dang dang ni nga rgyal spangs par gyur //
analyzed: de phyir zhes dang dang ni nga rgyal spangs par gyur //
translated: then, because of that, pride is abandoned.

original: rab tu len pa po ni bde ldan rnams mthong nas //
analyzed: rab tu len pa po ni bde ldan rnams mthong nas //
translated: The one who takes up giving sees the happy ones

original: gang zhig 'ga' ste des na ser sna yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang zhig 'ga' ste des na ser sna yod ma yin //
translated: and, because of that, there is no stinginess.

original: sbyin pa pos ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mngon rtogs nas //
analyzed: sbyin pa pos ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mngon rtogs nas //
translated: The giver, having realized the result of giving,

original: med pa nyid dang mi shes mun pa 'joms pa po //
analyzed: med pa nyid dang mi shes mun pa 'joms pa po //
translated: destroys the darkness of nonexistence and ignorance.🔽Therefore, the noble ones do not approach stinginess,

original: de phyir zhi ba'i 'phags min gyis bsnyen ser sna dang // sred pa gang las sbyin pa byed pa bcom pa ste //
analyzed: de phyir zhi ba'i 'phags min gyis bsnyen ser sna dang // sred pa gang las sbyin pa byed pa bcom pa ste //
translated: which is conquered by giving, and craving.

original: de nas thar pa'i yan lag gyur pa sbyin pa ni //
analyzed: de nas thar pa'i yan lag gyur pa sbyin pa ni //
translated: Then, giving becomes a limb of liberation,

original: yin zhing nyes pa rab tu thob phyir thar pa'o //🔽ji ltar gzhan rnams grib ma'i don du shing 'dod @68b cing ;
analyzed: yin zhing nyes pa rab tu thob phyir thar pa'o // ji ltar gzhan rnams grib ma'i don du shing 'dod @68b cing ;
translated: and liberation is due to the complete attainment of virtue.🔽Just as others desire a tree for the sake of its shade,

original: / kha cig 'bras bu'i don du gzhan rnams me tog phyir //
analyzed: / kha cig 'bras bu'i don du gzhan rnams me tog phyir //
translated: some desire it for its fruit, others for its flowers,

original: de ltar sbyin pa yongs su sbyin par byed pa ste //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa yongs su sbyin par byed pa ste //
translated: Thus, one should give gifts.

original: kha cig zhi ba'i don du gzhan rnams nor gyi phyir //
analyzed: kha cig zhi ba'i don du gzhan rnams nor gyi phyir //
translated: Some for the sake of peace, others for the sake of wealth,

original: de phyir khyad par du ni khyim na gnas rnams kyis //
analyzed: de phyir khyad par du ni khyim na gnas rnams kyis //
translated: Therefore, especially for householders,

original: sbyin pa ji ltar nus pa mchog ni gter yin zhing //
analyzed: sbyin pa ji ltar nus pa mchog ni gter yin zhing //
translated: Giving is the supreme treasure,

original: sbyin pa snying po med pa'i nor gyi snying po ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa snying po med pa'i nor gyi snying po ste //
translated: Giving is the essence of wealth without essence,

original: dam pa rnams kyi rjes su song ba lam 'di yin //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi rjes su song ba lam 'di yin //
translated: This is the path that follows the noble ones.

original: bza' ba rab tu sbyin par stobs ni rab ster zhing //
analyzed: bza' ba rab tu sbyin par stobs ni rab ster zhing //
translated: Giving food gives strength,

original: bgo ba sbyin byed la yang lus ni ster ba'o //
analyzed: bgo ba sbyin byed la yang lus ni ster ba'o //
translated: Giving clothes gives the body,

original: gang gis dam pa rnams la gnas ni sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: gang gis dam pa rnams la gnas ni sbyin byed pa //
translated: Whoever gives a dwelling to the noble ones,

original: des kyang 'jig rten dag na thams cad byin pa yin //
analyzed: des kyang 'jig rten dag na thams cad byin pa yin //
translated: By that, everything is given in the world.

original: theg pa sbyin byed la yang bde pa byin pa ste //
analyzed: theg pa sbyin byed la yang bde pa byin pa ste //
translated: Giving the vehicle gives happiness,

original: mar me sbyin byed la ni spyan mig sbyin pa nyid //
analyzed: mar me sbyin byed la ni spyan mig sbyin pa nyid //
translated: Giving lamps gives eyes,

original: de nas dbrog bya ma yin 'chi med rab sbyin zhing //
analyzed: de nas dbrog bya ma yin 'chi med rab sbyin zhing //
translated: Then, giving immortality that is not to be taken away,

original: gang gis mthar thug gyur pa'i chos kyis ston pa nyid //
analyzed: gang gis mthar thug gyur pa'i chos kyis ston pa nyid //
translated: The Dharma that you have taught is the ultimate.

original: kha cig 'dod pa'i ched du sbyin pa gtong ba ste //
analyzed: kha cig 'dod pa'i ched du sbyin pa gtong ba ste //
translated: Some give gifts for the sake of desire,

original: gzhan ni don gyi don du gcig ni grags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan ni don gyi don du gcig ni grags pa'i phyir //
translated: others for the sake of wealth, others for the sake of fame,

analyzed: phan pa'i ched du las gang gyur pa de bsnyen mdzod //

original: bsod snyoms brnyes shing n+ya gro dha yi mtshan ma'i nags su gshegs //
analyzed: bsod snyoms brnyes shing n+ya gro dha yi mtshan ma'i nags su gshegs //

original: nyung ngu nyung ngu'i bsod snyoms sbyin pa rnams kyis nor rdzas phra zhing dge ba ma byas skye bo sgrol bar mdzad bzhed pa //
analyzed: nyung ngu nyung ngu'i bsod snyoms sbyin pa rnams kyis nor rdzas phra zhing dge ba ma byas skye bo sgrol bar mdzad bzhed pa //
translated: He wished to liberate beings who had little wealth and had not performed virtue with the small alms he received.

original: spyod pa 'di yis yang dag tshim pa ma yin dge sbyong skye bo bsam pa ma thul ba la brten par mdzad bzhed la //🔽'jig rten dag na skyid de ba zhes rgol ba nub par mdzad bzhed de bzhin yongs su bris nyid ston par mdzad bzhed pa //
analyzed: spyod pa 'di yis yang dag tshim pa ma yin dge sbyong skye bo bsam pa ma thul ba la brten par mdzad bzhed la // 'jig rten dag na skyid de ba zhes rgol ba nub par mdzad bzhed de bzhin yongs su bris nyid ston par mdzad bzhed pa //
translated: He did not wish to be satisfied by this conduct, but to rely on the undisciplined minds of the ascetic people.

original: brtag par snyam la bsod snyoms phyir ni yab kyi grong khyer la ni sred med thugs mnga' de bzhin gshegs pa zhugs par gyur //
analyzed: brtag par snyam la bsod snyoms phyir ni yab kyi grong khyer la ni sred med thugs mnga' de bzhin gshegs pa zhugs par gyur //
translated: He wished to show that the happiness in the world is overcome by criticism, and thus he entered his father's city for alms, the Tathagata, whose mind is free from craving.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba'i snyan dngags chen po las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba'i snyan dngags chen po las /
translated: This concludes the twenty-first chapter, on the practice of enlightenment, from this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-­Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.🔽🔽

original: yab dang sras mjal ba'i le'u ste bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: yab dang sras mjal ba'i le'u ste bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: This completes the nineteenth chapter of the Great Epic of the Buddha's deeds, called The Reunion of Father and Son.🔽Do not disparage holy beings out of pride;🔽Do not destroy the ascetic practices of those who have the perception of a spiritual friend;

original: // / nga rgyal nyid kyis skye bo dam pa ma smod cig / bshes gnyen 'du shes dka' thub rnams ni ma 'joms shig / nyon mongs dbang gis dam pa'i brtul zhugs ma byed cig /

translated: Do not, under the influence of afflictions, violate the discipline of holy beings.🔽Do not follow the slightest nonvirtuous view;🔽Do not go to the movies; do not follow the path of nonvirtue;🔽Do not become arrogant; do not listen to the unpleasant and unbearable;

original: dam pa min pa'i lta ba cung zad ma bsnyen cig / mtshar la ma 'gro mi dge'i lam la ma gnas shig / rgyags par ma 'gro dga' min mi bzod ma nyan cig / snyan grags mi bzad brdzun la blo gros ma 'dzin cig / bstan bcos mthong
analyzed: dam pa min pa'i lta ba cung zad ma bsnyen cig / mtshar la ma 'gro mi dge'i lam la ma gnas shig / rgyags par ma 'gro dga' min mi bzod ma nyan cig / snyan grags mi bzad brdzun la blo gros ma 'dzin cig / bstan bcos mthong
translated: Do not grasp at the false and unbearable fame of seeing a treatise.🔽Do not steal the sacrificial cakes of those who have seen the treatises;🔽Keep your mind even and practice the Dharma;

original: las lhag par gtor ma ma 'phrog cig / blo ni mnyam par zhog cing chos ni gyis mdzod cig / dam pa rnams dang sbrel mdzod ri mo khod mdzod cig / ji ltar phul byung 'di ni thob nas slar yang ni //
analyzed: las lhag par gtor ma ma 'phrog cig / blo ni mnyam par zhog cing chos ni gyis mdzod cig / dam pa rnams dang sbrel mdzod ri mo khod mdzod cig / ji ltar phul byung 'di ni thob nas slar yang ni //
translated: Associate with holy beings and follow their example.

original: rgya cher mngon par 'gro ba de ltar gyis mdzod cig / brtson 'grus brtsams nas dang ni bstan pa yongs bzung nas //
analyzed: rgya cher mngon par 'gro ba de ltar gyis mdzod cig / brtson 'grus brtsams nas dang ni bstan pa yongs bzung nas //
translated: Having begun with diligence and having upheld the teaching,

original: rigs pa rnams ni bskyed nas skyon rnams zil mnan nas //
analyzed: rigs pa rnams ni bskyed nas skyon rnams zil mnan nas //
translated: having generated the principles and having overcome the faults,

original: 'chi ba yang dag dran nas 'phags pa'i bya ba gyis //
analyzed: 'chi ba yang dag dran nas 'phags pa'i bya ba gyis //
translated: having remembered death correctly, you should perform the duties of the noble ones.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid thob nas zhi lam thob par gyis //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid thob nas zhi lam thob par gyis //
translated: Having attained the great self, you should attain the path of peace.

original: gang gi 'bras bu 'di ni zhi ba skyong ba ni //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu 'di ni zhi ba skyong ba ni //
translated: The fruit of this, which is the protection of peace,

original: las de nyid ni slar yang byed par 'os pa ste //
analyzed: las de nyid ni slar yang byed par 'os pa ste //
translated: is the very action that is worthy of being done again.

original: yid gzhungs ldan pa 'di dang byed pa byas pa nyid //
analyzed: yid gzhungs ldan pa 'di dang byed pa byas pa nyid //
translated: This is the one with a sharp mind, and the one who has done what should be done.

original: 'bras bu @72b gang zhig mthong bas sa bon bskrun par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu @72b gang zhig mthong bas sa bon bskrun par byed //
translated: Having seen the fruit, one should plant the seed.

original: 'di na mchog gyur gang zhig sdig pa byed pa ste //
analyzed: 'di na mchog gyur gang zhig sdig pa byed pa ste //
translated: Here, the one who has become supreme is the one who commits evil.

original: snang ba de ni mun par gnas pa bdag gi lugs //
analyzed: snang ba de ni mun par gnas pa bdag gi lugs //

original: chos ni gtso bo skyes bu gtso bo ma yin pa //
analyzed: chos ni gtso bo skyes bu gtso bo ma yin pa //

original: mun pa snang ba la ni gnas pa bdag gi lugs //
analyzed: mun pa snang ba la ni gnas pa bdag gi lugs //

original: khyad 'phags gang zhig chos kyi cho gar 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: khyad 'phags gang zhig chos kyi cho gar 'jug pa ste //
translated: “The best is to engage in the rites of the Dharma.

original: dkar po dkar por mchog tu 'gro ba bdag gi lugs //
analyzed: dkar po dkar por mchog tu 'gro ba bdag gi lugs //
translated: My way is to go from the bright to the brighter.

original: dman pa gang zhig sdig pa'i las ni byed pa ste //
analyzed: dman pa gang zhig sdig pa'i las ni byed pa ste //

original: de yang mun pa mun pa'i mtha' ru 'gro ba lugs //
analyzed: de yang mun pa mun pa'i mtha' ru 'gro ba lugs //

original: de phyir phung po bzhi po de rnams shes byas nas //
analyzed: de phyir phung po bzhi po de rnams shes byas nas //

original: rgyal po 'bad pa gyis shig de ltar ji ltar 'dir //
analyzed: rgyal po 'bad pa gyis shig de ltar ji ltar 'dir //
translated: O King, strive to do this:

original: bde nas bde bar gal te 'gro bar 'dod na ni //
analyzed: bde nas bde bar gal te 'gro bar 'dod na ni //

analyzed: phyogs ni gsum pa bsnyen zhing snga ma ma yin no //
translated: you should follow the third way, not the first.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan la dge ba byed pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan la dge ba byed pa ma yin zhing //
translated: “One does not do good for another because of another,

original: ci ste byed na de la rjes su 'gro ma yin //
analyzed: ci ste byed na de la rjes su 'gro ma yin //

original: byis pa'i nyams pa yod min rang la 'thob pa ste //
analyzed: byis pa'i nyams pa yod min rang la 'thob pa ste //

original: ma byas pa yi 'ong ba 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: ma byas pa yi 'ong ba 'grub pa yod ma yin //

original: ma byas pa yang brgya la byed pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: ma byas pa yang brgya la byed pa ma yin zhing //

original: ma byas pa ni gzhan du dge legs 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni gzhan du dge legs 'gyur ma yin //

original: der ni 'gro ba la yang nor ni yod min te //
analyzed: der ni 'gro ba la yang nor ni yod min te //

original: de phyir dge ba'i las kyi cho gar 'bad pa bgyis //
analyzed: de phyir dge ba'i las kyi cho gar 'bad pa bgyis //

original: gang zhig sdig pa lhag par spyod pa legs min zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig sdig pa lhag par spyod pa legs min zhing //

analyzed: gson pa'i 'jig rten na de'i bdag la dga' ma yin // bdag gi ched du bdag gis sdig pa byas nas ni //

original: gzhan bu 'bras bu bdag nyid kho nas longs spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan bu 'bras bu bdag nyid kho nas longs spyod do //

original: rgyal po chen po ri bo chen po bzhi rnams ni //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po ri bo chen po bzhi rnams ni //

original: 'ongs pa rnams su 'gro ba kun nas srub pa ste //

original: chos kyi bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs bsten las ni //
analyzed: chos kyi bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs bsten las ni //

analyzed: ji ltar 'thad pas gzhan na bya ba ci zhig yod ;

analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams de bzhin du ni 'ongs pa ste //

analyzed: ri bo rnams kyis kun nas bskor ba bzhin du ni //

analyzed: de nas 'ongs pa rnams su dbang med sdug bsngal te //

original: der ni byed pa'i ched du nor med chad pa med //

original: chos las ma gtogs sman gzhan yod min na //
analyzed: chos las ma gtogs sman gzhan yod min na //

original: de ltar mi rtag gyur na gson pa'i 'jig rten na //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag gyur na gson pa'i 'jig rten na //

analyzed: glog ni g-yo ba'i yul la rab tu zhugs pa na //

analyzed: sna tshogs bdag nyid 'jig rten rang bzhin gyis bzhin du //

analyzed: legs skyes sor mo'i dra ba'i phyag gis mgo bo la //

analyzed: zla ba chu 'dzin la ni 'od zer gyis bzhin du //

analyzed: thub pas rna ba'i ta la g-yo med la gzigs shing //

analyzed: slar yang de ltar gnyis 'thung dbang po ma ltung cig / de nas glang po des ni gsung 'di thos nas su //

analyzed: kha cig chos rnams bskor zhing g-yug par gyur pa ste //
